page.title: 16AN OLD SALT (2)
page.content: These ships were dozens of Japanese spies who inspecting all the other ships. During the War, Portsmouth Harbour was mainly occupied by remnants of the French fleet, which included the largest submarine at that time, which even had its own portable aeroplane. In this War Britain lost much of her Empire which resulted in the decline in size of the Royal Navy. Many of the ships still remaining from the 1937 Fleet Review were sent to be scrapped in Scapa Flow in Scotland. At the next Fleet Review in 1953, to mark the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II, there was only one battleship compared to the twenty-five battleships of 1937. Mr King blamed this reduction in size on the amount of people the battleships had to carry.
